channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Brew Mini: Comic Book Bros
item.author: Mary Tobler

item.title: Exclusive: Post-Pandemic, Summer Travel Trends to Watch
item.description: Of the top 20 most popular flight deals Scott's Cheap Flights sent subscribers over the last two months, multiple were roundtrips to Hawaii and Alaska. 39% of travelers said they're concerned about travel costs. While more travelers are looking to get their delayed Eurotrip on, domestic travel is still the name of the game this summer, Keyes said. When countries announce they're reopening borders for US travelers, there's a predictable spike in flight searches to that destination, according to Keyes. Almost 60% said the frequency of their summer travel plans is similar to pre-pandemic levels. Of the 30% of respondents who work remotely at least one day a week, 42% said it's positively impacted their ability to travel. ¬†Some people don't know what they're doing yetDue to pandemic uncertainty, many travelers have waited until closer to their intended travel date to book.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Business Trends to Watch This Summer
item.description: But there are other consumer trends I'm excited to watch this summer. ¬†‚ÄîNeal FreymanCryptoMaybe I'm on Twitter too much, but cryptocurrency, and more specifically cryptocurrency regulation, is the top business topic I'll be watching this summer. Vaccine inequality¬†In just six months, the US has vaccinated over half its adult population, a remarkable feat considering how much we seemed to lag other countries in controlling the virus last year. Is home fitness here to stay even as gyms reopen? Let us know if we missed any. I think the big thing to watch is whether supply chains getting back to normal will cause the inflation scaries to subside. In the last two months, there have been gas, lumber, chip, ketchup, worker, and boba shortages, just to name a few that had accompanying Morning Brew pieces. Inflation data over the summer will reveal whether this quirkiness is more permanent than officials had thought. ¬†‚ÄîYiran Yu ¬†Btw, have you experienced the awkwardness of a post-Covid hug/handshake? After soaring more than 400% in 2020, Peloton's stock is down almost 24% this year. Maybe.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: So You Survived a Year of Virtual School‚Ä¶Now What?
item.description: ‚ÄîFatima Ali, Brew U Campus Ambassador, University of Wisconsin, Class of 2021)Here are some resources to get you to be your most productive self:How to Track Your Networking with Notion (Medium)2020's Most Popular Coursera Courses (Coursera)How to Find a Hobby (The New York Times)The 10 Most Popular TEDx talks (Ted)Relax and Self-Care‚ÄúI would say to just ride the wave and try not to force anything too much. I wish I would‚Äôve taken more time prior to this to explore alternative careers and network with people in different industries, and I highly encourage other college students to do so before deciding what exactly they want to do.‚Äù ‚ÄîColleen McFall, Morning Brew Intern, Temple University, Class of 2022‚ÄúExplore people, projects, and career paths that interest you... College students have endured one of the most exhaustive school years ever due to the pandemic, and finally now have the chance to relax, breathe, and celebrate. Coming into college I didn‚Äôt know what I wanted to use my major for. ‚ÄîKate Schiliro, Morning Brew fulfillment, New York University, Class of 2020‚ÄúDon‚Äôt stress as much. ‚ÄîJoshua Botkin, Morning Brew Intern, University of Cincinnati, Class of 2023Here are some resources for your career exploration:Marketing Brew‚Äôs Internship Guide. (Morning Brew)How to Cold Email Your Way into Your Dream Job. (Morning Brew)How to Get an Internship During Covid. (Morning Brew)2021 Grad‚Äôs Guide to Getting Hired.
item.author: Yiran Yu

item.title: Police Raid a Bitcoin Mining Operation On Accident
item.description: That‚Äôs why British police accidentally busted a cryptocurrency mining operation earlier this month, thinking it was an illegal cannabis farm. Zoom out: While stealing electricity is illegal in the UK, mining bitcoin is a-okay.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Costco Sees Inflationary Pressures, but Will Restart Free Samples
item.description: Overall, the company said that price inflation at the selling level, excluding gasoline, was 2.5%‚Äì3.5%, much higher than in March. Costco was one of the first US retailers to mandate masks in early May 2020. Costco is the only place where you can simultaneously buy seven-pound tubs of Nutella and learn about the state of the post-pandemic economy. And probably come back in two minutes and hope you forget our face. But hey, we‚Äôll take it. And samples will be given behind plexiglass screens.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Brew Crossword: Perfect Pitch

item.title: Costco Sees Inflationary Pressures, but Will Restart Free Samples
item.description: Overall, the company said that price inflation at the selling level, excluding gasoline, was 2.5%‚Äì3.5%, much higher than in March. ¬†However, this being the ‚Äúnew normal‚Äù and all, some pandemic precautions will remain in place. Costco is the only place where you can buy seven-pound tubs of Nutella and learn about the state of the post-pandemic economy. And probably come back in two minutes and hope you forget our face. But hey, we‚Äôll take it. Costco was one of the first US retailers to mandate masks in early May 2020.

item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Icebreakers with‚Ä¶ John Green
item.description: I would love for there to be a Major League Soccer team in Indianapolis, but I would not want to own it. What's something that podcasting offers that books don't and vice versa? Tell us about something you love doing that you're terrible at. And tell us about something you really do not like doing that you're great at. What star rating would you give the five-star rating scale? ¬†Name three books on your nightstand right now:Clint Smith's How the Word Is Passed, Ashley C. ¬†If you could own any sports franchise other than the English soccer team AFC Wimbledon, of which you are a huge fan, what would it be? In 175 words, one can say much more about a book (or a movie, or a hotel, or a barbershop) than a single data point ever could.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Did the Coronavirus Get Leaked From a Lab?
item.description: Right-wing pundits and conservative lawmakers, particularly Sen. Tom Cotton, were pushing the US government to investigate claims that the virus came from the Wuhan Institute of Virology. ¬†As researchers studied Covid-19's origins last year, the natural origin theory dominated and the lab leak theory was considered preposterous. this lab leak theory may not be as crazy as it sounds." But as 2020 went on, scientists found no evidence to support the natural origin theory, China was stonewalling any credible independent investigation, and people started saying, "You know what... Lab leak: A scientist at the Wuhan Institute of Virology, which studies bat viruses, was infected with a contagious strain through a sloppy mistake or an accident, and brought it out to the wider world.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Make It Work: New Jobs Edition
item.description: Let's think about how we can reimagine your question so that you can get the answer you need without looking crazy to your boss (because you did lowkey wait eight months to ask your manager how to do the job lol). ¬†Q: "I started a new role at my company (virtually) about eight months ago with no formal training. ¬†Q: "I have a job offer from one company, but the company I really want to work for has scheduled my interview for the end of the week. How can I buy some time with the company that gave me the offer?"
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Important Summer Dates
item.description: ¬†Lollapalooza is back in Chicago from July 29 to August 1. June¬†Lana Del Rey releases her new album, Rock Candy Sweet, June 1, followed by Blue Banisters on July 4. Soccer's Euro tournament begins June 11 and runs a full month. JulyMarvel's Black Widow is taking over theaters on July 9. Your boy Luca is coming to Disney+ on June 18. No spectators were allowed at the 2020 US Open, but tennis fans can fill the stands this year from August 30‚ÄìSeptember 12.
item.author: Yiran Yu

item.title: Where Morning Brew Readers Are Going for Memorial Day¬†
item.description: ‚ÄîMatt L." I have to settle with heading to my friends at the Jersey shore for MDW, if that counts as traveling." ¬†"I'm going to a lake house in Tennessee with Hinge boy and his pals üíÉüíÉüíÉ for Memorial Day. What a time." A staycation with my family is all I want and to take a day to remember all those we have lost. Going to the promised land of Moses Lake, WA! ‚ÄîMatthew A."
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: May 28
item.description: Javier Tebas, the president of Spanish soccer's La Liga, is not giving up on the concept of a European "Super League," which fizzled embarrassingly in less than 48 hours last month. Read: A deep dive into the Citizen app, which critics say is promoting vigilantism.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Disney's 'Cruella' Signals a Pivot to PG-13
item.description: In the same time span, PG movies earned $24.3 billion; R movies, $26.5 billion; and G movies, $2.7 billion, according to Comscore. Cruella is Disney's third PG-13 release in a year, according to the WSJ. Today, Disney's live-action Cruella arrives in theaters and on Disney+.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Acorns Plans SPAC IPO Amidst Talks of Regulation
item.description: SEC Chairman Gary Gensler said yesterday that the agency is beefing up resources to look into the SPAC boom, which many fintechs like Acorns have taken advantage of. ¬†He might not have to wait long. But even the biggest name in SPACs, Chamath Palihapitiya, wants more oversight of the process.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Biden to Propose $6T Budget
item.description: This morning, President Biden will send Congress a jumbo-sized $6 trillion budget for FY2022, the NYT reported yesterday. Not the only new bill on Capitol HillYesterday, GOP senators released a $928 billion counteroffer to Biden's infrastructure package, more than half of which would go to roads and bridges. , is technically hammered out through 12 appropriations bills passed by Congress and signed by the president.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Biden to Propose $6T Budget
item.description: Not the only new bill on Capitol HillYesterday, GOP senators released a $928 billion counteroffer to Biden's infrastructure package, more than half of which would go to roads and bridges. This morning, President Biden will send Congress a jumbo-sized $6 trillion budget for FY2022, the NYT reported yesterday. , is technically hammered out through 12 appropriations bills passed by Congress and signed by the president.

item.title: The Dow Turns 125
item.description: 125 years ago yesterday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average first appeared in the Wall Street Journal. ¬†But Dowters say the index‚Äôs share-price weighting, plus its limited number of companies, makes it a poor representation of Corporate America.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: May 27
item.description: It‚Äôs got a long way to go: In the US, the company‚Äôs largest market, Ford‚Äôs EV sales have accounted for 1.2% of this year's total through April. (Experience) ¬†¬†Read: How the pandemic saved the fast food industry.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Facebook and Instagram Finally Offer Option to Hide Likes
item.description: But after a bunch of testing, Instagram found that user wellbeing and app usage didn‚Äôt change when likes were removed. After years of talking about it, Facebook officially released its likes-hiding option on Facebook and Instagram. Despite little evidence that removing likes would accomplish...
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Amazon Acquires MGM for $8.5 Billion
item.description: Amazon will get a leg up at the Emmys too, and not just because MGM houses The Handmaid‚Äôs Tale, Fargo, and Vikings, but also because it‚Äôs a studio capable of churning out more prestige TV. MGM could make Amazon Prime Video more than the streaming service you forgot you‚Äôre subscribed to.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Activist Investor Wins Two of Four Exxon Board Seats
item.description: As if there weren‚Äôt enough ü§¨¬† emojis in the Big Oil group chat yesterday, Shell was hit with a historic L of its own. The backstory: In December, Engine No. 1, then a brand new hedge fund, bought ~$40 million of Exxon shares‚Äîjust 0.02% of the company‚Äîand sent a letter to the board with a simple request: Invest in clean energy, or else. Following a vote at the company‚Äôs shareholder meeting yesterday, the activist investment firm Engine No. 1 won at least two of the four board seats it was aiming for.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Facebook and Instagram Finally Offer Option to Hide Likes
item.description: But interestingly enough, after a bunch of testing, Instagram found that user wellbeing and app usage didn‚Äôt change when likes were removed. Head of Instagram Adam Mosseri said that the hiding likes option was first created to ‚Äúdepressurize the experience‚Äù on the platform.
